intro: Saurauia urdanetensis, commonly known as the Urdanet hoya, is a flowering plant native to Venezuela. It belongs to the family Convallariaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is often found in rocky or shaded areas, thriving in humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
